BuildBotLocale.name: BuildBotLocale
BuildBotLocale.documentation: Builds a bot, its intents, and its slot types into a specific locale. A bot can be built into multiple locales. At runtime the locale is used to choose a specific build of the bot.

CreateBotAlias.name: CreateBotAlias
CreateBotAlias.documentation:
Creates an alias for the specified version of a bot. Use an alias to enable you to change the version of a bot without updating applications that use the bot.

For example, you can create an alias called "PROD" that your applications use to call the Amazon Lex bot.

CreateBotLocale.name: CreateBotLocale
CreateBotLocale.documentation: Creates a locale in the bot. The locale contains the intents and slot types that the bot uses in conversations with users in the specified language and locale. You must add a locale to a bot before you can add intents and slot types to the bot.

CreateBotVersion.name: CreateBotVersion
CreateBotVersion.documentation:
Creates a new version of the bot based on the DRAFT version. If the DRAFT version of this resource hasn't changed since you created the last version, Amazon Lex doesn't create a new version, it returns the last created version.

When you create the first version of a bot, Amazon Lex sets the version to 1. Subsequent versions increment by 1.

CreateExport.name: CreateExport
CreateExport.documentation:
Creates a zip archive containing the contents of a bot or a bot locale. The archive contains a directory structure that contains JSON files that define the bot.

You can create an archive that contains the complete definition of a bot, or you can specify that the archive contain only the definition of a single bot locale.

For more information about exporting bots, and about the structure of the export archive, see Importing and exporting bots

CreateIntent.name: CreateIntent
CreateIntent.documentation:
Creates an intent.

To define the interaction between the user and your bot, you define one or more intents. For example, for a pizza ordering bot you would create an OrderPizza intent.

When you create an intent, you must provide a name. You can optionally provide the following:

  • Sample utterances. For example, "I want to order a pizza" and "Can I order a pizza." You can't provide utterances for built-in intents.

  • Information to be gathered. You specify slots for the information that you bot requests from the user. You can specify standard slot types, such as date and time, or custom slot types for your application.

  • How the intent is fulfilled. You can provide a Lambda function or configure the intent to return the intent information to your client application. If you use a Lambda function, Amazon Lex invokes the function when all of the intent information is available.

  • A confirmation prompt to send to the user to confirm an intent. For example, "Shall I order your pizza?"

  • A conclusion statement to send to the user after the intent is fulfilled. For example, "I ordered your pizza."

  • A follow-up prompt that asks the user for additional activity. For example, "Do you want a drink with your pizza?"

CreateResourcePolicy.name: CreateResourcePolicy
CreateResourcePolicy.documentation: Creates a new resource policy with the specified policy statements.

CreateResourcePolicyStatement.name: CreateResourcePolicyStatement
CreateResourcePolicyStatement.documentation:
Adds a new resource policy statement to a bot or bot alias. If a resource policy exists, the statement is added to the current resource policy. If a policy doesn't exist, a new policy is created.

You can't create a resource policy statement that allows cross-account access.

CreateSlot.name: CreateSlot
CreateSlot.documentation: Creates a slot in an intent. A slot is a variable needed to fulfill an intent. For example, an OrderPizza intent might need slots for size, crust, and number of pizzas. For each slot, you define one or more utterances that Amazon Lex uses to elicit a response from the user.

CreateSlotType.name: CreateSlotType
CreateSlotType.documentation:
Creates a custom slot type

To create a custom slot type, specify a name for the slot type and a set of enumeration values, the values that a slot of this type can assume.

CreateUploadUrl.name: CreateUploadUrl
CreateUploadUrl.documentation: Gets a pre-signed S3 write URL that you use to upload the zip archive when importing a bot or a bot locale.

DeleteBot.name: DeleteBot
DeleteBot.documentation:
Deletes all versions of a bot, including the Draft version. To delete a specific version, use the DeleteBotVersion operation.

When you delete a bot, all of the resources contained in the bot are also deleted. Deleting a bot removes all locales, intents, slot, and slot types defined for the bot.

If a bot has an alias, the DeleteBot operation returns a ResourceInUseException exception. If you want to delete the bot and the alias, set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true.

DeleteBotLocale.name: DeleteBotLocale
DeleteBotLocale.documentation:
Removes a locale from a bot.

When you delete a locale, all intents, slots, and slot types defined for the locale are also deleted.

DeleteBotVersion.name: DeleteBotVersion
DeleteBotVersion.documentation: Deletes a specific version of a bot. To delete all version of a bot, use the DeleteBot operation.

DeleteCustomVocabulary.name: DeleteCustomVocabulary
DeleteCustomVocabulary.documentation: Removes a custom vocabulary from the specified locale in the specified bot.

DeleteExport.name: DeleteExport
DeleteExport.documentation: Removes a previous export and the associated files stored in an S3 bucket.

DeleteImport.name: DeleteImport
DeleteImport.documentation: Removes a previous import and the associated file stored in an S3 bucket.

DeleteIntent.name: DeleteIntent
DeleteIntent.documentation:
Removes the specified intent.

Deleting an intent also deletes the slots associated with the intent.

DeleteResourcePolicy.name: DeleteResourcePolicy
DeleteResourcePolicy.documentation: Removes an existing policy from a bot or bot alias. If the resource doesn't have a policy attached, Amazon Lex returns an exception.

DeleteResourcePolicyStatement.name: DeleteResourcePolicyStatement
DeleteResourcePolicyStatement.documentation: Deletes a policy statement from a resource policy. If you delete the last statement from a policy, the policy is deleted. If you specify a statement ID that doesn't exist in the policy, or if the bot or bot alias doesn't have a policy attached, Amazon Lex returns an exception.

DeleteSlot.name: DeleteSlot
DeleteSlot.documentation: Deletes the specified slot from an intent.

DeleteSlotType.name: DeleteSlotType
DeleteSlotType.documentation:
Deletes a slot type from a bot locale.

If a slot is using the slot type, Amazon Lex throws a ResourceInUseException exception. To avoid the exception, set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true.

DeleteUtterances.name: DeleteUtterances
DeleteUtterances.documentation:
Deletes stored utterances.

Amazon Lex stores the utterances that users send to your bot. Utterances are stored for 15 days for use with the ListAggregatedUtterances operation, and then stored indefinitely for use in improving the ability of your bot to respond to user input..

Use the DeleteUtterances operation to manually delete utterances for a specific session. When you use the DeleteUtterances operation, utterances stored for improving your bot's ability to respond to user input are deleted immediately. Utterances stored for use with the ListAggregatedUtterances operation are deleted after 15 days.

DescribeBotAlias.name: DescribeBotAlias
DescribeBotAlias.documentation: Get information about a specific bot alias.

DescribeBotLocale.name: DescribeBotLocale
DescribeBotLocale.documentation: Describes the settings that a bot has for a specific locale.

DescribeBotRecommendation.name: DescribeBotRecommendation
DescribeBotRecommendation.documentation: Provides metadata information about a bot recommendation. This information will enable you to get a description on the request inputs, to download associated transcripts after processing is complete, and to download intents and slot-types generated by the bot recommendation.

DescribeBotVersion.name: DescribeBotVersion
DescribeBotVersion.documentation: Provides metadata about a version of a bot.

DescribeCustomVocabularyMetadata.name: DescribeCustomVocabularyMetadata
DescribeCustomVocabularyMetadata.documentation: Provides metadata information about a custom vocabulary.

DescribeResourcePolicy.name: DescribeResourcePolicy
DescribeResourcePolicy.documentation: Gets the resource policy and policy revision for a bot or bot alias.

DescribeSlotType.name: DescribeSlotType
DescribeSlotType.documentation: Gets metadata information about a slot type.

ListAggregatedUtterances.name: ListAggregatedUtterances
ListAggregatedUtterances.documentation:
Provides a list of utterances that users have sent to the bot.

Utterances are aggregated by the text of the utterance. For example, all instances where customers used the phrase "I want to order pizza" are aggregated into the same line in the response.

You can see both detected utterances and missed utterances. A detected utterance is where the bot properly recognized the utterance and activated the associated intent. A missed utterance was not recognized by the bot and didn't activate an intent.

Utterances can be aggregated for a bot alias or for a bot version, but not both at the same time.

Utterances statistics are not generated under the following conditions:

  • The childDirected field was set to true when the bot was created.

  • You are using slot obfuscation with one or more slots.

  • You opted out of participating in improving Amazon Lex.

ListBotAliases.name: ListBotAliases
ListBotAliases.documentation: Gets a list of aliases for the specified bot.

ListBotLocales.name: ListBotLocales
ListBotLocales.documentation: Gets a list of locales for the specified bot.

ListBotRecommendations.name: ListBotRecommendations
ListBotRecommendations.documentation: Get a list of bot recommendations that meet the specified criteria.

ListBotVersions.name: ListBotVersions
ListBotVersions.documentation:
Gets information about all of the versions of a bot.

The ListBotVersions operation returns a summary of each version of a bot. For example, if a bot has three numbered versions, the ListBotVersions operation returns for summaries, one for each numbered version and one for the DRAFT version.

The ListBotVersions operation always returns at least one version, the DRAFT version.

ListBuiltInIntents.name: ListBuiltInIntents
ListBuiltInIntents.documentation:
Gets a list of built-in intents provided by Amazon Lex that you can use in your bot.

To use a built-in intent as a the base for your own intent, include the built-in intent signature in the parentIntentSignature parameter when you call the CreateIntent operation. For more information, see CreateIntent.

ListBuiltInSlotTypes.name: ListBuiltInSlotTypes
ListBuiltInSlotTypes.documentation: Gets a list of built-in slot types that meet the specified criteria.

ListExports.name: ListExports
ListExports.documentation: Lists the exports for a bot, bot locale, or custom vocabulary. Exports are kept in the list for 7 days.

ListImports.name: ListImports
ListImports.documentation: Lists the imports for a bot, bot locale, or custom vocabulary. Imports are kept in the list for 7 days.

ListIntents.name: ListIntents
ListIntents.documentation: Get a list of intents that meet the specified criteria.

ListRecommendedIntents.name: ListRecommendedIntents
ListRecommendedIntents.documentation: Gets a list of recommended intents provided by the bot recommendation that you can use in your bot.

ListSlotTypes.name: ListSlotTypes
ListSlotTypes.documentation: Gets a list of slot types that match the specified criteria.

ListSlots.name: ListSlots
ListSlots.documentation: Gets a list of slots that match the specified criteria.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Gets a list of tags associated with a resource. Only bots, bot aliases, and bot channels can have tags associated with them.

SearchAssociatedTranscripts.name: SearchAssociatedTranscripts
SearchAssociatedTranscripts.documentation: Search for associated transcripts that meet the specified criteria.

StartBotRecommendation.name: StartBotRecommendation
StartBotRecommendation.documentation: Use this to provide your transcript data, and to start the bot recommendation process.

StartImport.name: StartImport
StartImport.documentation: Starts importing a bot, bot locale, or custom vocabulary from a zip archive that you uploaded to an S3 bucket.

StopBotRecommendation.name: StopBotRecommendation
StopBotRecommendation.documentation: Stop an already running Bot Recommendation request.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource. If a tag key already exists, the existing value is replaced with the new value.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes tags from a bot, bot alias, or bot channel.

UpdateBot.name: UpdateBot
UpdateBot.documentation: Updates the configuration of an existing bot.

UpdateBotAlias.name: UpdateBotAlias
UpdateBotAlias.documentation: Updates the configuration of an existing bot alias.

UpdateBotLocale.name: UpdateBotLocale
UpdateBotLocale.documentation: Updates the settings that a bot has for a specific locale.

UpdateExport.name: UpdateExport
UpdateExport.documentation:
Updates the password used to protect an export zip archive.

The password is not required. If you don't supply a password, Amazon Lex generates a zip file that is not protected by a password. This is the archive that is available at the pre-signed S3 URL provided by the DescribeExport operation.

UpdateResourcePolicy.name: UpdateResourcePolicy
UpdateResourcePolicy.documentation: Replaces the existing resource policy for a bot or bot alias with a new one. If the policy doesn't exist, Amazon Lex returns an exception.

UpdateSlotType.name: UpdateSlotType
UpdateSlotType.documentation: Updates the configuration of an existing slot type.

audioRecognitionStrategy.documentation: Enables using the slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

AdvancedRecognitionSetting.documentation: Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values.

name.documentation: The name of the field to filter the utterance list.

values.documentation: The value to use for filtering the list of bots.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListAggregatedUtterances operation should return only utterances that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListAggregatedUtterances operation should return utterances that contain the specified value.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the aggregated utterances in ascending or descending order.

AggregatedUtterancesSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of utterances.

utterance.documentation: The text of the utterance. If the utterance was used with the RecognizeUtterance operation, the text is the transcription of the audio utterance.

hitCount.documentation: The number of times that the utterance was detected by Amazon Lex during the time period. When an utterance is detected, it activates an intent or a slot.

missedCount.documentation: The number of times that the utterance was missed by Amazon Lex An utterance is missed when it doesn't activate an intent or slot.

utteranceFirstRecordedInAggregationDurat.documentation: The date and time that the utterance was first recorded in the time window for aggregation. An utterance may have been sent to Amazon Lex before that time, but only utterances within the time window are counted.

utteranceLastRecordedInAggregationDurati.documentation: The last date and time that an utterance was recorded in the time window for aggregation. An utterance may be sent to Amazon Lex after that time, but only utterances within the time window are counted.

containsDataFromDeletedResources.documentation: Aggregated utterance data may contain utterances from versions of your bot that have since been deleted. When the aggregated contains this kind of data, this field is set to true.

AggregatedUtterancesSummary.documentation: Provides summary information for aggregated utterances. The ListAggregatedUtterances operations combines all instances of the same utterance into a single aggregated summary.

transcript.documentation: The content of the transcript that meets the search filter criteria. For the JSON format of the transcript, see Output transcript format.

AssociatedTranscript.documentation: The object containing information that associates the recommended intent/slot type with a conversation.

name.documentation: The name of the field to use for filtering. The allowed names are IntentId and SlotTypeId.

values.documentation: The values to use to filter the transcript.

AssociatedTranscriptFilter.documentation: Filters to search for the associated transcript.

startTimeoutMs.documentation: Time for which a bot waits before assuming that the customer isn't going to speak or press a key. This timeout is shared between Audio and DTMF inputs.

AudioAndDTMFInputSpecification.documentation: Specifies the audio and DTMF input specification.

s3Bucket.documentation: The Amazon S3 bucket where the audio log files are stored. The IAM role specified in the roleArn parameter of the CreateBot operation must have permission to write to this bucket.

AudioLogDestination.documentation: The location of audio log files collected when conversation logging is enabled for a bot.

enabled.documentation: Determines whether audio logging in enabled for the bot.

AudioLogSetting.documentation: Settings for logging audio of conversations between Amazon Lex and a user. You specify whether to log audio and the Amazon S3 bucket where the audio file is stored.

maxLengthMs.documentation: Time for how long Amazon Lex waits before speech input is truncated and the speech is returned to application.

endTimeoutMs.documentation: Time for which a bot waits after the customer stops speaking to assume the utterance is finished.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that was used in the event.

startDate.documentation: The date and time that the event started.

endDate.documentation: The date and time that the event ended.

BotAliasHistoryEvent.documentation: Provides a record of an event that affects a bot alias. For example, when the version of a bot that the alias points to changes.

enabled.documentation: Determines whether the locale is enabled for the bot. If the value is false, the locale isn't available for use.

codeHookSpecification.documentation: Specifies the Lambda function that should be used in the locale.

BotAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: Specifies settings that are unique to a locale. For example, you can use different Lambda function depending on the bot's locale.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the bot alias. You can use this ID to get detailed information about the alias using the DescribeBotAlias operation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that the bot alias references.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current state of the bot alias. If the status is Available, the alias is ready for use.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot alias was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot alias was last updated.

BotAliasSummary.documentation: Summary information about bot aliases returned from the ListBotAliases operation.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot assigned by Amazon Lex.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that was exported. This will be either DRAFT or the version number.

BotExportSpecification.documentation: Provides the identity of a the bot that was exported.

name.documentation: The name of the field to filter the list of bots.

values.documentation: The value to use for filtering the list of bots.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListBots operation should return only aliases that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListBots operation should return aliases that contain the specified value.

BotFilter.documentation: Filters the responses returned by the ListBots operation.

botName.documentation: The name that Amazon Lex should use for the bot.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to build and run the bot.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.

You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

botTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

testBotAliasTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

BotImportSpecification.documentation: Provides the bot parameters required for importing a bot.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to create the locale for.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to export.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale to export. The string must match one of the locales in the bot.

BotLocaleExportSpecification.documentation: Provides the bot locale parameters required for exporting a bot locale.

name.documentation: The name of the field to filter the list of bots.

values.documentation: The value to use for filtering the list of bots.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListBotLocales operation should return only aliases that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListBotLocales operation should return aliases that contain the specified value.

event.documentation: A description of the event that occurred.

eventDate.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the event occurred.

BotLocaleHistoryEvent.documentation: Provides information about an event that occurred affecting the bot locale.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to import the locale to.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to import the locale to. This can only be the DRAFT version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation:
Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.

For example, suppose a bot is configured with the confidence threshold of 0.80 and the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. Amazon Lex returns three alternative intents with the following confidence scores: IntentA (0.70), IntentB (0.60), IntentC (0.50). The response from the PostText operation would be:

  • AMAZON.FallbackIntent

  • IntentA

  • IntentB

  • IntentC

BotLocaleImportSpecification.documentation: Provides the bot locale parameters required for importing a bot locale.

attribute.documentation: The bot locale attribute to sort by.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the bot locales in ascending or descending order.

BotLocaleSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bot locales.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale of the bot locale.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot locale. When the status is Built the locale is ready for use.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot locale was last updated.

lastBuildSubmittedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot locale was last built.

BotLocaleSummary.documentation: Summary information about bot locales returned by the ListBotLocales operation.

intents.documentation: Statistical information about about the intents associated with the bot recommendation results.

slotTypes.documentation: Statistical information about the slot types associated with the bot recommendation results.

BotRecommendationResultStatistics.documentation: A statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

botLocaleExportUrl.documentation: The presigned URL link of the recommended bot definition.

associatedTranscriptsUrl.documentation: The presigned url link of the associated transcript.

statistics.documentation: The statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

BotRecommendationResults.documentation: The object representing the URL of the bot definition, the URL of the associated transcript, and a statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

botRecommendationStatus.documentation:
The status of the bot recommendation.

If the status is Failed, then the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation to be updated.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was last updated.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of bots.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can choose ascending or descending.

BotSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bots.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the bot. Use this ID to get detailed information about the bot with the DescribeBot operation.

botStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot. When the status is Available the bot is ready for use.

latestBotVersion.documentation: The latest numerical version in use for the bot.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the bot was last updated.

BotSummary.documentation: Summary information about a bot returned by the ListBots operation.

sourceBotVersion.documentation: The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

BotVersionLocaleDetails.documentation: The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of versions.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can specify ascending or descending order.

BotVersionSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bot versions.

botName.documentation: The name of the bot associated with the version.

botVersion.documentation: The numeric version of the bot, or DRAFT to indicate that this is the version of the bot that can be updated..

botStatus.documentation: The status of the bot. When the status is available, the version of the bot is ready for use.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the version was created.

BotVersionSummary.documentation: Summary information about a bot version returned by the ListBotVersions operation.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to build. The identifier is returned in the response from the CreateBot operation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to build. This can only be the draft version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the specified bot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that was built. This is only the draft version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale specified of where the bot can be used.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The bot's build status. When the status is ReadyExpressTesting you can test the bot using the utterances defined for the intents and slot types. When the status is Built, the bot is ready for use and can be tested using any utterance.

lastBuildSubmittedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp indicating the date and time that the bot was last built for this locale.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of built-in intents.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can specify ascending or descending order.

BuiltInIntentSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of built-in intents.

intentSignature.documentation: The signature of the built-in intent. Use this to specify the parent intent of a derived intent.

BuiltInIntentSummary.documentation: Provides summary information about a built-in intent for the ListBuiltInIntents operation.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of built-in intents.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can choose ascending or descending.

BuiltInSlotTypeSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of built-in slot types.

slotTypeSignature.documentation: The signature of the built-in slot type. Use this to specify the parent slot type of a derived slot type.

description.documentation: The description of the built-in slot type.

BuiltInSlotTypeSummary.documentation: Provides summary information about a built-in slot type for the ListBuiltInSlotTypes operation.

text.documentation: The text that appears on the button. Use this to tell the user what value is returned when they choose this button.

value.documentation: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button. This must be one of the slot values configured for the slot.

Button.documentation: Describes a button to use on a response card used to gather slot values from a user.

cloudWatchLogGroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group where text and metadata logs are delivered.

logPrefix.documentation: The prefix of the log stream name within the log group that you specified

CloudWatchLogGroupLogDestination.documentation: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group where the text and metadata logs are delivered. The log group must exist before you enable logging.

CodeHookSpecification.documentation: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

CompositeSlotTypeSetting.documentation: A composite slot is a combination of two or more slots that capture multiple pieces of information in a single user input.

Condition.documentation: Provides an expression that evaluates to true or false.

condition.documentation: Contains the expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, the branch's actions are taken.

ConditionalBranch.documentation: A set of actions that Amazon Lex should run if the condition is matched.

active.documentation: Determines whether a conditional branch is active. When active is false, the conditions are not evaluated.

conditionalBranches.documentation: A list of conditional branches. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step. The response and next step are executed when the condition is true.

defaultBranch.documentation: The conditional branch that should be followed when the conditions for other branches are not satisfied. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step.

ConditionalSpecification.documentation: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

ConflictException.documentation: The action that you tried to perform couldn't be completed because the resource is in a conflicting state. For example, deleting a bot that is in the CREATING state. Try your request again.

textLogSettings.documentation: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs settings for logging text and metadata.

audioLogSettings.documentation: The Amazon S3 settings for logging audio to an S3 bucket.

ConversationLogSettings.documentation: Configures conversation logging that saves audio, text, and metadata for the conversations with your users.

botAliasName.documentation: The alias to create. The name must be unique for the bot.

description.documentation: A description of the alias. Use this description to help identify the alias.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that this alias points to. You can use the UpdateBotAlias operation to change the bot version associated with the alias.

botAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: Maps configuration information to a specific locale. You can use this parameter to specify a specific Lambda function to run different functions in different locales.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: Specifies whether Amazon Lex logs text and audio for a conversation with the bot. When you enable conversation logs, text logs store text input, transcripts of audio input, and associated metadata in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Audio logs store audio input in Amazon S3.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that the alias applies to.

tags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the bot alias. You can only add tags when you create an alias, you can't use the UpdateBotAlias operation to update the tags on a bot alias. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot alias.

botAliasName.documentation: The name specified for the bot alias.

description.documentation: The description specified for the bot alias.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with this alias.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: The conversation log settings specified for the alias.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current status of the alias. The alias is first put into the Creating state. When the alias is ready to be used, it is put into the Available state. You can use the DescribeBotAlias operation to get the current state of an alias.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that this alias applies to.

creationDateTime.documentation: A Unix timestamp indicating the date and time that the bot alias was created.

tags.documentation: A list of tags associated with the bot alias.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to create the locale for.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to create the locale for. This can only be the draft version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

description.documentation: A description of the bot locale. Use this to help identify the bot locale in lists.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation:
Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.

For example, suppose a bot is configured with the confidence threshold of 0.80 and the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. Amazon Lex returns three alternative intents with the following confidence scores: IntentA (0.70), IntentB (0.60), IntentC (0.50). The response from the RecognizeText operation would be:

  • AMAZON.FallbackIntent

  • IntentA

  • IntentB

  • IntentC

voiceSettings.documentation: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

botId.documentation: The specified bot identifier.

botVersion.documentation: The specified bot version.

localeId.documentation: The specified locale identifier.

description.documentation: The specified description of the bot locale.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation: The specified confidence threshold for inserting the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents.

voiceSettings.documentation: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

botLocaleStatus.documentation:
The status of the bot.

When the status is Creating the bot locale is being configured. When the status is Building Amazon Lex is building the bot for testing and use.

If the status of the bot is ReadyExpressTesting, you can test the bot using the exact utterances specified in the bots' intents. When the bot is ready for full testing or to run, the status is Built.

If there was a problem with building the bot, the status is Failed. If the bot was saved but not built, the status is NotBuilt.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp specifying the date and time that the bot locale was created.

botName.documentation: The name of the bot. The bot name must be unique in the account that creates the bot.

description.documentation: A description of the bot. It appears in lists to help you identify a particular bot.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot.

dataPrivacy.documentation: Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.

You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

botTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you create a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

testBotAliasTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you create a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

botId.documentation: A unique identifier for a particular bot. You use this to identify the bot when you call other Amazon Lex API operations.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role specified for the bot.

dataPrivacy.documentation: The data privacy settings specified for the bot.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation: The session idle time specified for the bot.

botStatus.documentation: Shows the current status of the bot. The bot is first in the Creating status. Once the bot is read for use, it changes to the Available status. After the bot is created, you can use the Draft version of the bot.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp indicating the date and time that the bot was created.

botTags.documentation: A list of tags associated with the bot.

testBotAliasTags.documentation: A list of tags associated with the test alias for the bot.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to create the version for.

description.documentation: A description of the version. Use the description to help identify the version in lists.

botVersionLocaleSpecification.documentation: Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the Draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version.

botId.documentation: The bot identifier specified in the request.

description.documentation: The description of the version specified in the request.

botVersion.documentation: The version number assigned to the version.

botVersionLocaleSpecification.documentation: The source versions used for each locale in the new version.

botStatus.documentation: When you send a request to create or update a bot, Amazon Lex sets the status response element to Creating. After Amazon Lex builds the bot, it sets status to Available. If Amazon Lex can't build the bot, it sets status to Failed.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the version was created.

resourceSpecification.documentation: Specifies the type of resource to export, either a bot or a bot locale. You can only specify one type of resource to export.

fileFormat.documentation: The file format of the bot or bot locale definition files.

filePassword.documentation: An password to use to encrypt the exported archive. Using a password is optional, but you should encrypt the archive to protect the data in transit between Amazon Lex and your local computer.

exportId.documentation: An identifier for a specific request to create an export.

resourceSpecification.documentation: A description of the type of resource that was exported, either a bot or a bot locale.

fileFormat.documentation: The file format used for the bot or bot locale definition files.

exportStatus.documentation: The status of the export. When the status is Completed, you can use the DescribeExport operation to get the pre-signed S3 URL link to your exported bot or bot locale.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the request to export a bot was created.

intentName.documentation: The name of the intent. Intent names must be unique in the locale that contains the intent and cannot match the name of any built-in intent.

description.documentation: A description of the intent. Use the description to help identify the intent in lists.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: A unique identifier for the built-in intent to base this intent on.

sampleUtterances.documentation:
An array of strings that a user might say to signal the intent. For example, "I want a pizza", or "I want a {PizzaSize} pizza".

In an utterance, slot names are enclosed in curly braces ("{", "}") to indicate where they should be displayed in the utterance shown to the user..

dialogCodeHook.documentation:
Specifies that Amazon Lex invokes the alias Lambda function for each user input. You can invoke this Lambda function to personalize user interaction.

For example, suppose that your bot determines that the user's name is John. You Lambda function might retrieve John's information from a backend database and prepopulate some of the values. For example, if you find that John is gluten intolerant, you might set the corresponding intent slot, glutenIntolerant to true. You might find John's phone number and set the corresponding session attribute.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation:
Specifies that Amazon Lex invokes the alias Lambda function when the intent is ready for fulfillment. You can invoke this function to complete the bot's transaction with the user.

For example, in a pizza ordering bot, the Lambda function can look up the closest pizza restaurant to the customer's location and then place an order on the customer's behalf.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: Provides prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm the completion of an intent. If the user answers "no," the settings contain a statement that is sent to the user to end the intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: Sets the response that Amazon Lex sends to the user when the intent is closed.

inputContexts.documentation:
A list of contexts that must be active for this intent to be considered by Amazon Lex.

When an intent has an input context list, Amazon Lex only considers using the intent in an interaction with the user when the specified contexts are included in the active context list for the session. If the contexts are not active, then Amazon Lex will not use the intent.

A context can be automatically activated using the outputContexts property or it can be set at runtime.

For example, if there are two intents with different input contexts that respond to the same utterances, only the intent with the active context will respond.

An intent may have up to 5 input contexts. If an intent has multiple input contexts, all of the contexts must be active to consider the intent.

outputContexts.documentation:
A lists of contexts that the intent activates when it is fulfilled.

You can use an output context to indicate the intents that Amazon Lex should consider for the next turn of the conversation with a customer.

When you use the outputContextsList property, all of the contexts specified in the list are activated when the intent is fulfilled. You can set up to 10 output contexts. You can also set the number of conversation turns that the context should be active, or the length of time that the context should be active.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: Configuration information required to use the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent to connect to an Amazon Kendra index. The AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent is called when Amazon Lex can't determine another intent to invoke.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this intent.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this intent.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this intent is used. All of the bots, slot types, and slots used by the intent must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

initialResponseSetting.documentation: Configuration settings for the response that is sent to the user at the beginning of a conversation, before eliciting slot values.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: The signature of the parent intent specified for the intent.

sampleUtterances.documentation: The sample utterances specified for the intent.

dialogCodeHook.documentation: The dialog Lambda function specified for the intent.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation: The fulfillment Lambda function specified for the intent.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: The confirmation setting specified for the intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: The closing setting specified for the intent.

inputContexts.documentation: The list of input contexts specified for the intent.

outputContexts.documentation: The list of output contexts specified for the intent.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: Configuration for searching a Amazon Kendra index specified for the intent.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with the intent.

localeId.documentation: The locale that the intent is specified to use.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the intent was created.

initialResponseSetting.documentation: Configuration settings for the response that is sent to the user at the beginning of a conversation, before eliciting slot values.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

policy.documentation:
A resource policy to add to the resource. The policy is a JSON structure that contains one or more statements that define the policy. The policy must follow the IAM syntax. For more information about the contents of a JSON policy document, see IAM JSON policy reference .

If the policy isn't valid, Amazon Lex returns a validation exception.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy was attached to.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

statementId.documentation: The name of the statement. The ID is the same as the Sid IAM property. The statement name must be unique within the policy. For more information, see IAM JSON policy elements: Sid.

effect.documentation: Determines whether the statement allows or denies access to the resource.

principal.documentation: An IAM principal, such as an IAM users, IAM roles, or AWS services that is allowed or denied access to a resource. For more information, see AWS JSON policy elements: Principal.

action.documentation: The Amazon Lex action that this policy either allows or denies. The action must apply to the resource type of the specified ARN. For more information, see Actions, resources, and condition keys for Amazon Lex V2.

condition.documentation:
Specifies a condition when the policy is in effect. If the principal of the policy is a service principal, you must provide two condition blocks, one with a SourceAccount global condition key and one with a SourceArn global condition key.

For more information, see IAM JSON policy elements: Condition .

expectedRevisionId.documentation:
The identifier of the revision of the policy to edit. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.

If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex overwrites the contents of the policy with the new values.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

slotName.documentation: The name of the slot. Slot names must be unique within the bot that contains the slot.

description.documentation: A description of the slot. Use this to help identify the slot in lists.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier for the slot type associated with this slot. The slot type determines the values that can be entered into the slot.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: Specifies prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to elicit a response that provides the value for the slot.

obfuscationSetting.documentation:
Determines how slot values are used in Amazon CloudWatch logs. If the value of the obfuscationSetting parameter is DefaultObfuscation, slot values are obfuscated in the log output. If the value is None, the actual value is present in the log output.

The default is to obfuscate values in the CloudWatch logs.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the slot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, slot types used by the slot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

intentId.documentation: The identifier of the intent that contains the slot.

multipleValuesSetting.documentation:
Indicates whether the slot returns multiple values in one response. Multi-value slots are only available in the en-US locale. If you set this value to true in any other locale, Amazon Lex throws a ValidationException.

If the multipleValuesSetting is not set, the default value is false.

subSlotSetting.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots and the expression for the composite slot.

slotId.documentation: The unique identifier associated with the slot. Use this to identify the slot when you update or delete it.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the slot type associated with this slot.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: The value elicitation settings specified for the slot.

obfuscationSetting.documentation: Indicates whether the slot is configured to obfuscate values in Amazon CloudWatch logs.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot associated with the slot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot.

localeId.documentation: The language and local specified for the slot.

intentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the intent associated with the slot.

creationDateTime.documentation: The timestamp of the date and time that the slot was created.

multipleValuesSetting.documentation: Indicates whether the slot returns multiple values in one response.

subSlotSetting.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots and the expression for the composite slot.

slotTypeName.documentation: The name for the slot. A slot type name must be unique within the account.

description.documentation: A description of the slot type. Use the description to help identify the slot type in lists.

slotTypeValues.documentation: A list of SlotTypeValue objects that defines the values that the slot type can take. Each value can have a list of synonyms, additional values that help train the machine learning model about the values that it resolves for a slot.

valueSelectionSetting.documentation:
Determines the strategy that Amazon Lex uses to select a value from the list of possible values. The field can be set to one of the following values:

  • OriginalValue - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.

  • TopResolution - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list. If there is no resolution list, return null.

If you don't specify the valueSelectionSetting parameter, the default is OriginalValue.

parentSlotTypeSignature.documentation:
The built-in slot type used as a parent of this slot type. When you define a parent slot type, the new slot type has the configuration of the parent slot type.

Only AMAZON.AlphaNumeric is supported.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this slot type.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the bot version associated with this slot type.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot type will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, and slots used by the slot type must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

externalSourceSetting.documentation: Sets the type of external information used to create the slot type.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the slot type. Use this to identify the slot type in the UpdateSlotType and DeleteSlotType operations.

slotTypeName.documentation: The name specified for the slot type.

description.documentation: The description specified for the slot type.

slotTypeValues.documentation: The list of values that the slot type can assume.

valueSelectionSetting.documentation: The strategy that Amazon Lex uses to select a value from the list of possible values.

parentSlotTypeSignature.documentation: The signature of the base slot type specified for the slot type.

botId.documentation: The identifier for the bot associated with the slot type.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot type.

localeId.documentation: The specified language and local specified for the slot type.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the slot type was created.

externalSourceSetting.documentation: The type of external information used to create the slot type.

importId.documentation: An identifier for a unique import job. Use it when you call the StartImport operation.

uploadUrl.documentation: A pre-signed S3 write URL. Upload the zip archive file that contains the definition of your bot or bot locale.

value.documentation: The string that is sent to your application.

CustomPayload.documentation: A custom response string that Amazon Lex sends to your application. You define the content and structure the string.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the custom vocabulary to export.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the custom vocabulary to export.

localeId.documentation: The locale of the bot that contains the custom vocabulary to export.

CustomVocabularyExportSpecification.documentation: Provides the parameters required for exporting a custom vocabulary.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to import the custom vocabulary to.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to import the custom vocabulary to.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the local to import the custom vocabulary to. The value must be en_GB.

CustomVocabularyImportSpecification.documentation: Provides the parameters required for importing a custom vocabulary.

maxLength.documentation: The maximum number of DTMF digits allowed in an utterance.

endTimeoutMs.documentation: How long the bot should wait after the last DTMF character input before assuming that the input has concluded.

deletionCharacter.documentation: The DTMF character that clears the accumulated DTMF digits and immediately ends the input.

endCharacter.documentation: The DTMF character that immediately ends input. If the user does not press this character, the input ends after the end timeout.

childDirected.documentation: For each Amazon Lex bot created with the Amazon Lex Model Building Service, you must specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by specifying true or false in the childDirected field. By specifying true in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. By specifying false in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is not related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. You may not specify a default value for the childDirected field that does not accurately reflect whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. If your use of Amazon Lex relates to a website, program, or other application that is directed in whole or in part, to children under age 13, you must obtain any required verifiable parental consent under COPPA. For information regarding the use of Amazon Lex in connection with websites, programs, or other applications that are directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13, see the Amazon Lex FAQ.

DataPrivacy.documentation: By default, data stored by Amazon Lex is encrypted. The DataPrivacy structure provides settings that determine how Amazon Lex handles special cases of securing the data for your bot.

startDateTime.documentation: A timestamp indicating the start date for the date range filter.

endDateTime.documentation: A timestamp indicating the end date for the date range filter.

DateRangeFilter.documentation: The object used for specifying the data range that the customer wants Amazon Lex to read through in the input transcripts.

DefaultConditionalBranch.documentation: A set of actions that Amazon Lex should run if none of the other conditions are met.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot alias to delete.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot associated with the alias to delete.

skipResourceInUseCheck.documentation: When this parameter is true, Amazon Lex doesn't check to see if any other resource is using the alias before it is deleted.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot alias to delete.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that contains the alias to delete.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current status of the alias. The status is Deleting while the alias is in the process of being deleted. Once the alias is deleted, it will no longer appear in the list of aliases returned by the ListBotAliases operation.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that contains the locale.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the locale.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that will be deleted. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contained the deleted locale.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contained the deleted locale.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale of the deleted locale.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The status of deleting the bot locale. The locale first enters the Deleting status. Once the locale is deleted it no longer appears in the list of locales for the bot.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to delete.

skipResourceInUseCheck.documentation: When true, Amazon Lex doesn't check to see if another resource, such as an alias, is using the bot before it is deleted.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that Amazon Lex is deleting.

botStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot. The status is Deleting while the bot and its associated resources are being deleted.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the version.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to delete.

skipResourceInUseCheck.documentation: By default, the DeleteBotVersion operations throws a ResourceInUseException exception if you try to delete a bot version that has an alias pointing at it. Set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true to skip this check and remove the version even if an alias points to it.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that is being deleted.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that is being deleted.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot to remove the custom vocabulary from.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to remove the custom vocabulary from.

localeId.documentation: The locale identifier for the locale that contains the custom vocabulary to remove.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that the custom vocabulary was removed from.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that the custom vocabulary was removed from.

localeId.documentation: The locale identifier for the locale that the custom vocabulary was removed from.

customVocabularyStatus.documentation: The status of removing the custom vocabulary.

exportId.documentation: The unique identifier of the export to delete.
The unique identifier of the deleted export.

exportStatus.documentation: The current status of the deletion. When the deletion is complete, the export will no longer be returned by the ListExports operation and calls to the DescribeExport operation with the export identifier will fail.

importId.documentation: The unique identifier of the import to delete.
The unique identifier of the deleted import.

importStatus.documentation: The current status of the deletion. When the deletion is complete, the import will no longer be returned by the ListImports operation and calls to the DescribeImport operation with the import identifier will fail.

intentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the intent to delete.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the intent.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where the bot will be deleted. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that has the resource policy attached.

expectedRevisionId.documentation:
The identifier of the revision to edit. If this ID doesn't match the current revision number, Amazon Lex returns an exception

If you don't specify a revision ID, Amazon Lex will delete the current policy.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy was deleted from.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

statementId.documentation: The name of the statement (SID) to delete from the policy.

expectedRevisionId.documentation:
The identifier of the revision of the policy to delete the statement from. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.

If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex removes the current contents of the statement.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy statement was removed from.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

slotId.documentation: The identifier of the slot to delete.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the slot to delete.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot to delete.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot will be deleted from. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

intentId.documentation: The identifier of the intent associated with the slot.

slotTypeId.documentation: The identifier of the slot type to delete.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the slot type.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot type.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot type will be deleted from. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

skipResourceInUseCheck.documentation: By default, the DeleteSlotType operations throws a ResourceInUseException exception if you try to delete a slot type used by a slot. Set the skipResourceInUseCheck parameter to true to skip this check and remove the slot type even if a slot uses it.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that contains the utterances.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where the utterances were collected. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

sessionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the session with the user. The ID is returned in the response from the RecognizeText and RecognizeUtterance operations.

botAliasId.documentation: The identifier of the bot alias to describe.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the bot alias to describe.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the bot alias.

botAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: The locale settings that are unique to the alias.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: Specifics of how Amazon Lex logs text and audio conversations with the bot associated with the alias.

botAliasHistoryEvents.documentation: A list of events that affect a bot alias. For example, an event is recorded when the version that the alias points to changes.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current status of the alias. When the alias is Available, the alias is ready for use with your bot.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the bot alias.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the alias was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the alias was last updated.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the locale.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with the locale.

localeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the locale to describe. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the locale.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with the locale.

localeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the described locale.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation: The confidence threshold where Amazon Lex inserts the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents in the list of possible intents for an utterance.

voiceSettings.documentation: The Amazon Polly voice Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

intentsCount.documentation: The number of intents defined for the locale.

slotTypesCount.documentation: The number of slot types defined for the locale.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The status of the bot. If the status is Failed, the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

failureReasons.documentation: if botLocaleStatus is Failed, Amazon Lex explains why it failed to build the bot.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the locale was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the locale was last updated.

lastBuildSubmittedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the locale was last submitted for building.

botLocaleHistoryEvents.documentation: History of changes, such as when a locale is used in an alias, that have taken place for the locale.

recommendedActions.documentation: Recommended actions to take to resolve an error in the failureReasons field.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot associated with the bot recommendation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the bot recommendation.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to describe. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The identifier of the bot recommendation to describe.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the bot recommendation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the bot recommendation.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to describe.

botRecommendationStatus.documentation: The status of the bot recommendation. If the status is Failed, then the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The identifier of the bot recommendation being described.

failureReasons.documentation: If botRecommendationStatus is Failed, Amazon Lex explains why.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the bot recommendation was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the bot recommendation was last updated.

transcriptSourceSetting.documentation: The object representing the Amazon S3 bucket containing the transcript, as well as the associated metadata.

encryptionSetting.documentation: The object representing the passwords that were used to encrypt the data related to the bot recommendation results, as well as the KMS key ARN used to encrypt the associated metadata.

botRecommendationResults.documentation: The object representing the URL of the bot definition, the URL of the associated transcript and a statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot to describe.
The unique identifier of the bot.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot.

dataPrivacy.documentation: Settings for managing data privacy of the bot and its conversations with users.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation: The maximum time in seconds that Amazon Lex retains the data gathered in a conversation.

botStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot. When the status is Available the bot is ready to be used in conversations with users.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was last updated.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot containing the version to return metadata for.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to return metadata for.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the version.

botName.documentation: The name of the bot that contains the version.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to describe.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot version.

dataPrivacy.documentation: Data privacy settings for the bot version.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds that a session with the bot remains active before it is discarded by Amazon Lex.

botStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot. When the status is Available, the bot version is ready for use.

failureReasons.documentation: If the botStatus is Failed, this contains a list of reasons that the version couldn't be built.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot version was created.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that contains the custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The bot version of the bot to return metadata for.

localeId.documentation: The locale to return the custom vocabulary information for. The locale must be en_GB.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the custom vocabulary to describe.

localeId.documentation: The locale that contains the custom vocabulary to describe.

customVocabularyStatus.documentation: The status of the custom vocabulary. If the status is Ready the custom vocabulary is ready to use.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the custom vocabulary was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the custom vocabulary was last updated.

exportId.documentation: The unique identifier of the export to describe.
The unique identifier of the described export.

resourceSpecification.documentation: The bot, bot ID, and optional locale ID of the exported bot or bot locale.

fileFormat.documentation: The file format used in the files that describe the resource.

exportStatus.documentation: The status of the export. When the status is Complete the export archive file is available for download.

failureReasons.documentation: If the exportStatus is failed, contains one or more reasons why the export could not be completed.

downloadUrl.documentation: A pre-signed S3 URL that points to the bot or bot locale archive. The URL is only available for 5 minutes after calling the DescribeExport operation.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the export was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The last date and time that the export was updated.

importId.documentation: The unique identifier of the import to describe.
The unique identifier of the described import.

resourceSpecification.documentation: The specifications of the imported bot, bot locale, or custom vocabulary.

importedResourceId.documentation: The unique identifier that Amazon Lex assigned to the resource created by the import.

mergeStrategy.documentation: The strategy used when there was a name conflict between the imported resource and an existing resource. When the merge strategy is FailOnConflict existing resources are not overwritten and the import fails.

importStatus.documentation: The status of the import process. When the status is Completed the resource is imported and ready for use.

failureReasons.documentation: If the importStatus field is Failed, this provides one or more reasons for the failure.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the import was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the import was last updated.

intentId.documentation: The identifier of the intent to describe.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the intent.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the intent to describe. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

intentId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the intent when it was created.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: The identifier of the built-in intent that this intent is derived from, if any.

dialogCodeHook.documentation: The Lambda function called during each turn of a conversation with the intent.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation: The Lambda function called when the intent is complete and ready for fulfillment.

slotPriorities.documentation: The list that determines the priority that slots should be elicited from the user.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: Prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm completion of an intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: The response that Amazon Lex sends to when the intent is closed.

inputContexts.documentation: A list of contexts that must be active for the intent to be considered for sending to the user.

outputContexts.documentation: A list of contexts that are activated when the intent is fulfilled.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: Configuration information required to use the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the intent.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale specified for the intent.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the intent was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the intent was last updated.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

policy.documentation: The JSON structure that contains the resource policy. For more information about the contents of a JSON policy document, see IAM JSON policy reference .
